title.narrative: INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Strengthened early warning systems at central and municipal levels (including schools) to prevent, respond, and to monitor dropout cases, particularly among the most excluded children from all communities including Kosovo Serbs

mailing-address.narrative: Nr. 1 Ali Pashë Tepelena Street Prishtina

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of inclusive teacher training for children with disabilities
Provision of primary education teacher training
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

related-activity.ref: 8971/A0/05/001 CHILD HEALTH, DEVELP AND INCLUSIVE EDUC

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened early warning systems at central and municipal levels (including schools) to prevent, respond, and to monitor dropout cases, particularly among the most excluded children from all communities including Kosovo Serbs

description.narrative: The capacities of teachers on applying inclusive education techniques and methodologies have been increased in seven selected municipalities. Capacities of 100 PRTANs in 10 municipalities to identify children at risk of dropping out from school were enhanced. UNICEF Kosovo also supported establishment of the MEST working group responsible for the accreditation of skills-based education and its incorporation into the upper-secondary education curriculum. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of schools applying inclusive education approach
Existence of a protocol to protect children from violence, abuse and neglect in education institutions (RKLA3-4)
System Strengthening - Inclusive Ed. - Existence of appropriate law/policy explicitly mentioning the rights of children with disabilities to receive an education - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF Kosovo Office supported the drafting of Child Rights Strategy and Action Plan which was approved in 2019. UNICEF Kosovo advocated with national and local institutions for inclusion of children with disabilities.

title.narrative: Action plan for prevention of dropout from school developed
National Education statistical reports publish information on children not enrolled and not attending school (drop out, children never enrolled in school (RKLA 3-4)

target.value: 2020:EMIS system fully aligned with target SDG 4

actual.value: 2019:The EMIS/MEST finalized of the annual statistics for school year 2018/2019

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
Existence of regulations on Drop out (RKLA 3-4)

actual.value: 2019:Admin Instruction endorsed by MEST and it is in the process of being implemented
